page.title: 04RECREATION
page.content: Involvement in local clubs and societies is strong - sports clubs, social clubs run by political organisations, athletic clubs, local parent/teacher associations, amateur dramatics, Round Table, British Legion and church youth groups. There is also a local Canal Society. There is a thriving Girl Guide and Boy Scout Association in the area. Most popular are the Brownie and Cub sections, which cater for children between the ages of 7 and 10. Actvities organised for the children include venture walks and outdoor games. Achievement badges can be won and are shown on a special uniform. In this area lies Linnet Clough County Scout Camp, which is used by Scouts and Guides from all over the Country as well as Manchester school children as a base for field studies.
